column3: Back

I tried calling, but your phone was off.
It’s expensive, but worth it.
I studied hard, but still failed.
We wanted to go, but it rained.
I’m tired, but I’ll finish this.

I practised a lot. However, I still lost.
It looks easy. However, it’s really tricky.
We planned everything. However, something went wrong.
She’s young. However, she’s very experienced.
The hotel was cheap. However, it was awful.

The pay is good. On the other hand, the hours are long.
Summer is hot. On the other hand, winter is freezing.
Cats are independent. On the other hand, dogs need walks.
Trains are fast. On the other hand, planes are faster.
Working from home is quiet. On the other hand, you miss people.

It’s expensive. Having said that, the quality is excellent.
He’s lazy. Having said that, he’s very clever.
The film was long. Having said that, I loved it.
It rained all day. Having said that, we had fun.
Traffic is terrible. Having said that, I still love the city.

He’s difficult to work with. That said, he gets results.
It’s far away. That said, the view is amazing.
The job pays little. That said, I enjoy it.
She talks a lot. That said, she’s funny.
It’s risky. That said, it could be worth it.

It was raining hard. Even so, we went for a walk.
The price is high. Even so, I’ll buy it.
He apologised. Even so, I’m still upset.
It’s late. Even so, I’ll wait.
I’m tired. Even so, I’ll help you.

I don’t earn much. Still, I manage to save.
It’s cold outside. Still, I’ll go running.
He’s annoying. Still, he’s my brother.
The film was bad. Still, the popcorn was good.
I failed once. Still, I’ll try again.

It was expensive, though worth every penny.
He’s shy, though very kind.
The journey was long, though enjoyable.
It rained, though not heavily.
She complained, though smiled afterwards.

Although it was cold, we went swimming.
Although she’s young, she’s the boss.
Although I studied, I forgot everything.
Although he’s rich, he’s not happy.
Although tired, I finished the work.

I love coffee, whereas she prefers tea.
Some people exercise daily, whereas others never do.
City life is exciting, whereas the countryside is peaceful.
He speaks slowly, whereas she talks very fast.
Summer is hot, whereas winter is freezing.

While I like the design, I hate the colour.
While some enjoy parties, others prefer quiet nights.
While the book was brilliant, the film was terrible.
While he’s loud, his brother is shy.
While prices rose, salaries stayed the same.

Despite the rain, we had a great picnic.
Despite studying hard, she failed.
Despite being tired, he kept working.
Despite the traffic, we arrived on time.
Despite warnings, they went anyway.

In spite of the cold, we went camping.
In spite of his age, he runs marathons.
In spite of the noise, I slept well.
In spite of bad reviews, I loved the film.
In spite of feeling ill, she came to the party.

It’s a nice hotel. Mind you, it’s very expensive.
He’s clever. Mind you, he’s lazy too.
The food was good. Mind you, the service was slow.
She’s friendly. Mind you, she can be bossy.
It’s sunny today. Mind you, it might rain later.

I want to help, at the same time I’m very busy.
It’s stressful, at the same time exciting.
He’s annoying, at the same time funny.
It saves money, at the same time takes longer.
I love the city, at the same time I miss nature.

The journey was awful. Nevertheless, we made it.
It cost a fortune. Nevertheless, I bought it.
Everyone said no. Nevertheless, I tried.
It was risky. Nevertheless, it worked.
He was wrong. Nevertheless, I forgave him.

It was late. Nonetheless, she called.
The reviews were bad. Nonetheless, we went.
It rained all day. Nonetheless, we enjoyed it.
He’s difficult. Nonetheless, he’s talented.
Prices are high. Nonetheless, sales are good.

He has money, yet he’s not happy.
It looks easy, yet it’s really hard.
She studied hard, yet failed the exam.
It’s small, yet very comfortable.
He apologised, yet I’m still upset.

It might rain. All the same, I’ll go.
He warned me. All the same, I did it.
It’s expensive. All the same, I love it.
She said no. All the same, I asked again.
It was cold. All the same, we swam.

Be that as it may, we still need to finish by Friday.
Be that as it may, rules are rules.
Be that as it may, I’m not changing my mind.
Be that as it may, the meeting starts at nine.
Be that as it may, you’re still coming.

Some love cities. Conversely, others prefer villages.
Exercise energises me. Conversely, it exhausts him.
I work best mornings. Conversely, she’s a night owl.
Tea calms me. Conversely, coffee wakes me up.
He spends everything. Conversely, she saves.

Last year was warm. By contrast, this winter is freezing.
She’s outgoing. By contrast, he’s very quiet.
Trains are cheap. By contrast, planes are expensive.
Mondays are busy. By contrast, Sundays are relaxed.
The book was brilliant. By contrast, the film was awful.

It saves money. Then again, it takes more time.
It’s healthy. Then again, it tastes terrible.
It’s quiet here. Then again, nothing ever happens.
Summer is fun. Then again, it’s too hot.
He’s clever. Then again, he never studies.

Let’s go out… On second thought, I’m too tired.
I’ll have dessert… On second thought, no thanks.
We’ll take the train… On second thought, let’s drive.
I’ll call him… On second thought, maybe tomorrow.
Red looks good… On second thought, I’ll take blue.

I thought I’d hate it. Actually, I loved it.
I was going to bed. Actually, I’ll finish this first.
It looks difficult. Actually, it’s quite easy.
I don’t like coffee. Actually, I love espresso.
I was angry. Actually, I’m just disappointed.
